description: Count of residents living in each ward. Higher counts indicate larger resident populations.
Proportion of the total resident population aged 0-15 years. Higher percentages indicate a larger proportion of the resident population belong to that age group.
Proportion of the total resident population aged 16-64 years. Higher percentages indicate a larger proportion of the resident population belong to that age group.
Proportion of the total resident population aged 20-44 years. Higher percentages indicate a larger proportion of the resident population belong to that age group.
Proportion of the total resident population aged 65 or more years. Higher percentages indicate a larger proportion of the resident population belong to that age group.
Proportion of the total resident population aged 80 or more years. Higher percentages indicate a larger proportion of the resident population belong to that age group.
Median age of the resident population. Half of the resident population is below this age and half are above.
Number of people aged 65 years or above as a percentage of the working age population (16-64 years). Higher percentages indicate a larger share of pensioners relative to the resident labour force.

Percentage of people identifying their ethnic group as either Asian or Asian British, Mixed or Multiple ethnic groups, Black, Black British, Caribbean or African or other non-White ethnicity. Higher percentages indicate a larger proportion of residents self-identifying as of non-White ethnicity.

indicator: No people in household have English as a main language
description: Percentage of households with no occupants speaking English as their main language. Higher percentages indicate a larger proportion of households where no people in the household have English as a main language.
Percentage of households where all occupants are of the same ethnic group. Higher percentages indicate a larger proportion of households with occupants belonging to the same ethnic group.
Number of people per square kilometre. Higher densities indicate a larger number of people living in an area per square kilometre.
